poem:
### Jude's Reflection

A man slips through  
the ink shadows—  
not quite himself,  
but an echo,  
a crafted doppelgänger  
in print.  
  
The real one,  
born from love,  
walks quietly—  
casting his roles,  
he is a whisper,   
shifting in celluloid light,  
while the paper phantom  
remains loud,  
unbeaten,  
untamed.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Jude Law: ‘The persona built on stuff written about me is not me, it’s this other guy’ Actor Jude Law, 51, grew up in south-east London as the son of teachers. His breakthrough role in The Talented Mr Ripley earned him a Bafta, an Oscar nomination and enduring tabloid attention. Always versatile, he’s been cast in more complex roles as he’s aged, most recently playing Henry VIII in Firebrand. He’s currently starring in Star Wars:". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Jude Law: ‘The persona built on stuff written about me is not me, it’s this other guy’ Actor Jude Law, 51, grew up in south-east London as the son of teachers.
